==Background== Since Mexican President [[Felipe CalderÃ³n]] declared war on [[drug cartels]] in 2006, the country's death toll related to drug crime has been around 30,000.<ref name="foxnews">{{cite news |title=More Than 30,000 Killed in Mexico's Drug Violence |url=http://www.foxnews.com/world/2010/12/16/killed-mexicos-drug-violence/ |publisher=[[Fox News Channel]] |date=16 December 2010 |accessdate=18 December 2010}}</ref> Mayors and police have been specifically targeted; some beheaded, some tortured to death.<ref name="Lundin">{{cite news |title=A Fistful of Valor |first=Leigh |last=Lundin |url=http://criminalbrief.com/?p=14303 |work=Crime News |publisher=Criminal Brief |date=24 October 2010 |accessdate=25 October 2010}}</ref>
In early October 2010, [[TancÃ­taro]]'s mayor Gustavo SÃ¡nchez was found beaten to death with his hands tied behind his back. Elected in January, he'd stated "The fear is always there, but if you have courage and a desire to make a contribution, that outweighs the fear".
==Praxedis G. Guerrero valley== Prior to the war on drugs, rural [[PrÃ¡xedis G. Guerrero, Chihuahua|Praxedis G. Guerrero, Chihuahua]] was a quiet town. ==Personal life and views== Valles Garcia is married and the mother of a baby boy.<ref name=aol>{{cite news |title=Marisol Valles Garcia is Mexico's Youngest Police Chief |first1=Francisco |last1=Mendoza |first2=Marcela |last2=Sarmiento |url=http://noticias.aollatino.com/2010/10/25/marisol-valles-garcia/?icid=main%257Cmain |newspaper=[[AOL|AOL News]] |date=25 October 2010 |accessdate=8 March 2011}}</ref> She reportedly took the job to change her community.<ref name="aol" /> "We're all afraid in Mexico now. The district has 9,148 inhabitants, and a police force of nineteen. Valles Garcia said she intended to hire more women, and focus on community outreach and prevention.<ref name="msnbc">{{cite news |title=20-year-old student named police chief in Mexico town |first= |last= |url=http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/39760545/ns/world_news-americas/ |newspaper=[[MSNBC]] |date=20 October 2010 |accessdate=21 October 2010}}</ref> In neighboring JuÃ¡rez, she was referred to by locals with the iconic nickname "[[La Adelita]]".{{Citation needed|date=November 2010}}
